question: 補う
sourceMnemonic: Because the hiragana ends with an <ja>う</ja> sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>supplement</kanji> so the verb vocab version is <vocabulary>to supplement</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic: <reading>Oh, gee, now</reading> (<ja>おぎな</ja>) you're going <vocabulary>to supplement</vocabulary> it? That would have been helpful earlier. Might help to say "oh gee now" with a <ja>ぎ</ja> sound instead of "ji" sound out loud, too. This is a tricky reading, won't be learned too easily, so think about it a bit now.
